bedaa6bf-7671-45ba-a370-f6595f79c224.description: Earners understand COVID-19 and safety protocols to return to campus. Earners can explain how the virus spreads and identify COVID-19 symptoms, safety protocols if you become ill or care for someone who is ill, good hygiene and cleaning practices to protect yourself and others, and protective methods to avoid close contact with others.
bedaa6bf-7671-45ba-a370-f6595f79c224.name: COVID-19 Awareness Student Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all 5 modules of UMBC's Return to Campus online, self-paced training for Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19), in collaboration with Safety Matters, Inc.
Score 80% or higher on the final quiz

b53d390f-d435-4994-929d-8c44cad012ea.description: Earners understand COVID-19 and safety protocols to return to campus. Earners can explain how the virus spreads and identify COVID-19 symptoms, safety protocols if you become ill or care for someone who is ill, good hygiene and cleaning practices to protect yourself and others, and protective methods to avoid close contact with others.
b53d390f-d435-4994-929d-8c44cad012ea.name: COVID-19 Awareness Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all 5 modules of UMBC's Return to Campus online, self-paced training for Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19), in collaboration with Safety Matters, Inc.
Score 80% or higher on the final quiz

c376db37-ef7c-4803-bf08-d24875bb97eb.description: This badge signifies the basic overview knowledge of Academic Integrity at UMBC. Academic integrity is a vital ethical commitment of the UMBC community. Each new UMBC degree-seeking graduate student is required to complete the Academic Integrity Tutorial. Participants have an understanding of the definition for academic integrity, how to recognize plagiarism, ways to practice ethical scholarship, and importance of citing intellectual property.
c376db37-ef7c-4803-bf08-d24875bb97eb.name: Academic Integrity Tutorial Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the course or the course equivalent.
The student must complete the final assessment with the score of 85% or better.

a0d628a1-03a7-4817-b193-d4328abf02e4.description: The badge earner is a college or university student who understands how to make informed financial decisions, from orientation to graduation and beyond.
a0d628a1-03a7-4817-b193-d4328abf02e4.name: CashCourse Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all CashCourse modules with passing scores

16008bab-e88d-4bd7-8399-4015b3219a0d.description: Earners of the Employee Cybersecurity Awareness badge have demonstrated basic knowledge of UMBC's information classification process, understand the process to follow when something looks suspicious, and recognize the most common threats to the campus.
16008bab-e88d-4bd7-8399-4015b3219a0d.name: Employee Cybersecurity Awareness

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all 7 modules of UMBC’s Employee Cybersecurity Awareness online self-paced training.
Score 80% or higher on the quiz

77211801-212a-4d22-92f4-c4e6f47e5b37.description: This badge signfies learning and skill development for administrative support professionals across five Maryland universities. The earner has demonstrated knowledge, skills and abilities in strengths identification, career management, interpersonal skills, customer service, networking, time management and organizational skills.
77211801-212a-4d22-92f4-c4e6f47e5b37.name: Building Bridges Across Maryland

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Be nominated by Deans and VPs
Complete the Building Bridges Across Maryland program

Create a team video with colleagues from their university answering the following questions: How has this program impacted your professional/personal life? What do you appreciate about the connections you made in this cohort experience?

439df24d-a86b-42f6-a1d0-d946924fdf3a.description: The Professional badge earner has demonstrated personal accountability, effective work habits, integrity, and commitment. The earner takes responsibility for their actions and outcomes, examines the implications of their own behavior and decisions, acknowledges mistakes and learns from them, and follows through on commitments. The earner perseveres in the face of challenges and acts with the interest of the larger community in mind.
439df24d-a86b-42f6-a1d0-d946924fdf3a.name: UMBC Professional "Edge" Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Thoughtfully complete all assignments for the Intern Success Practicum.
Obtain a strong performance evaluation from the intern site supervisor, with ratings of “Good” or better in all areas.

Submit a 1-2 minute video reflection on top accomplishments, career-related skills, and personal strengths developed through the internship/co-op/research, as well as career goals and the next steps to further those goals.

b9fb79cb-3168-4cd0-b433-a2a05ad21903.description: This competency examines and investigates data governance issues and why data governance is important to data science and data analytics by the way of current events and articles on data ethics. Students will identify concerns around data collection, personal privacy issues, liability issues, ethical constraints, and bias that impact data analysis. Students will also examine the ethical issues around compliance when it comes to using data for making decisions.
b9fb79cb-3168-4cd0-b433-a2a05ad21903.name: Digital Tech Credential: Data Ethics

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the module or the UMBC course equivalent.
The student must complete the module with the score of 80% or better, or successfully complete the equivalent UMBC course with a final grade of C or better.

1ab38bcf-4b9a-4c1e-895f-ee16ffe4657e.description: This competency explores the role that data plays in our everyday lives and why it is important to the world of Data Science. Students will identify what makes data useful and how data are stored; different types of data and differentiate data typologies; and different data applications including transactional data, business intelligence, informational data, social networking, and artificial intelligence.
1ab38bcf-4b9a-4c1e-895f-ee16ffe4657e.name: Digital Tech Credential: The Role of Data and Analytics

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the module or the UMBC course equivalent.
The student must complete the module with the score of 80% or better, or successfully complete the equivalent UMBC course with a final grade of C or better.

a16c6e79-9734-4999-a365-dc55cb21d551.description: This competency examines and applies data manipulation techniques to prepare data for analysis. Students will identify how and why data manipulation is important to the role of data scientists and perform data preparation (remove duplicates, recoding, filtering, and formatting) on a provided dataset. Students will also apply analysis techniques on prepared data set using Pivot Charts and summarize data with Pivot Tables.
a16c6e79-9734-4999-a365-dc55cb21d551.name: Digital Tech Credential: Data Manipulation

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the module or the UMBC course equivalent.
The student must complete the module with the score of 80% or better, or successfully complete the equivalent UMBC course with a final grade of C or better.

9d31da82-976a-4dd5-b1e0-aefa50d84825.description: The 28th Annual UMBC McNair Research Conference was held virtually on 9/17/2020. Attendees gathered to network with and be inspired by fellow National McNair participants, connect with representatives from McNair-friendly graduate programs, and present their research, making lasting connections with those with similar research interests. The conference provides opportunities that increase the attainment of research-based doctoral degrees by students from underrepresented segments of society.
9d31da82-976a-4dd5-b1e0-aefa50d84825.name: McNair Conference Presenter 2020

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Presenters submitted an abstract describing their research. They also presented their own slide(s) using Zoom. Poster Presentations occurred in 30-mins sessions with 3 scholars presenting per session. Poster presentations were uploaded to the conference website prior to the session. Poster presenters made 5 minute presentations with 3 additional minutes for Q&A. Oral Presentations occurred in 20-minute increments; presentations were 12-minutes each with 3 additional minutes for Q&A.

90fdbc97-9640-499e-8f99-7b7fd33d8f2b.description: This competency introduces the role that data security plays in our everyday, the common threats to security, and techniques that help protect and ensure the integrity of data. Students identify and apply information assurance principles of confidentiality, integrity, availability; identify the concepts risk management and risk management life cycles; describe the spectrum and implications of insider threats; explain various methods to prevent insider threats; and more.
90fdbc97-9640-499e-8f99-7b7fd33d8f2b.name: Digital Tech Credential: Data Security

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the module or the UMBC course equivalent.
The student must complete the module with the score of 80% or better, or successfully complete the equivalent UMBC course with a final grade of C or better.

d849a120-b3ed-4427-810f-74db3eaba1c7.description: The Collaborator badge earner has demonstrated collaboration, professionalism, and the ability to be a successful and contributing member of a team. The Collaborator can articulate team roles, integrate diverse viewpoints, motivate and support team members, build upon or synthesize the contributions of others, and offer ideas, suggestions, alternative solutions, and feedback. They can account for their role and responsibilities and negotiate, manage, and resolve conflicts when they arise.
d849a120-b3ed-4427-810f-74db3eaba1c7.name: Interdisciplinary Collaborator Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete CoLab program, a 4-week, 30-hour/week, 3-credit paid internship

Work with a faculty member, engage in collaborative narrative-based research and produce a public-facing final project, demonstrating research ethics, principles of storytelling, and digital production.

872c82f8-ae3d-4704-9e2f-d063594bb595.description: This competency steps through the process of developing a hypothesis and using data to test the hypothesis. Using COVID-19 data from 2020, students will investigate if the proximity to New York Subway stations had any association with the concentrations of positive COVID-19 cases. Students will also explore regression modeling to test hypotheses.
872c82f8-ae3d-4704-9e2f-d063594bb595.name: Digital Tech Credential: Probability and Descriptive and Inferential Statistics

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the module or the UMBC course equivalent.
The student must complete the module with the score of 80% or better, or successfully complete the equivalent UMBC course with a final grade of C or better.

14cf578f-a838-4c3c-9bc5-8a58ef323b25.description: This competency explores the role of data visualization. Students will identify early players in the data visualization field and advanced data visualizations of today, examine the steps in creating a data brief to inform the story to tell with data and fundamental design components, and create a simple data visualization using open source tools.
14cf578f-a838-4c3c-9bc5-8a58ef323b25.name: Digital Tech Credential: Data Visualization and Communication

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the module or the UMBC course equivalent.
The student must complete the module with the score of 80% or better, or successfully complete the equivalent UMBC course with a final grade of C or better.

aaa9666a-3a8b-4ef3-9b5a-0f240487ac33.description: The 29th Annual McNair Research Conference was held on September 17th and 18th. Attendees gathered to network with and be inspired by fellow National McNair participants, connect with representatives from McNair-friendly graduate programs, and present their research, making lasting connections with those with similar research interests. The conference provides opportunities that increase the attainment of research-based doctoral degrees by students from historically excluded segments of society
aaa9666a-3a8b-4ef3-9b5a-0f240487ac33.name: McNair Conference Presenter 2021

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Presenters submitted an abstract describing their research. They also presented their own slide(s) using Zoom platform. Poster Presentations occurred in one-hour sessions with 6 scholars presenting per session. Poster presentations were uploaded to the conference website prior to the session. Poster presenters made 5-minute presentations with 3 additional minutes for Q&A. Oral Presentations occurred in 20-minute increments; presentations were 12-minutes each with 3 additional minutes for Q&A.
Presenters completed Pre and Post self-reflections focused on their goals towards a successful and worthwhile conference experience.

8d120dfa-f77f-489e-90b0-ec81b3e6b85b.description: This badge signifies learning and skill development in the area of leadership. Earners have demonstrated intentional learning and change in the area of leadership and project management, including leadership influence, project management essentials, facilitation skills, and innovation.
8d120dfa-f77f-489e-90b0-ec81b3e6b85b.name: Personal Leadership and Project Management

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Be nominated by Deans and VPs
Complete the Personal Leadership and Project Managment (PLPM) cohort program.
Complete a final presentation to showcase learning

105d2965-7754-433f-b77f-f5e4e35a3353.description: This badge signifies learning and skill development in the area of supervision. Participants who hold this badge have gone through a 3-part Effective Supervisor cohort program.
105d2965-7754-433f-b77f-f5e4e35a3353.name: Effective Supervision

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete The Effective Supervisor 3-part series
Submit evidence of learning including journal entries and a personal leadership statement/philosophy

be931e33-07f6-48b5-b813-6e076a6e7a38.description: The Generalist Credential primarily focuses on Data Analytics, Visualization & Security. It is intended for undergraduate students pursuing degrees in non-technical fields such as human resources, logistics, finance, or other humanities-related fields. This credential incorporates knowledge, skills, and abilities needed by industry for entry-level positions in a wide variety of occupations. There are 6 competency areas identified for the Generalist Credential.
be931e33-07f6-48b5-b813-6e076a6e7a38.name: Digital Tech Credential: Generalist

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must earn the following 6 competency badges:

4dc67054-12c7-4500-973e-6dfb6f1f4982.description: Earners of UMBC's Institute of Extended Learning's Biotech Boot Camp badge have successfully completed a 4-week boot camp in the high-demand life sciences/biotechnology industry. A variety of topics were introduced and practiced, including Good Manufacturing Practices, safety protocols, documentation, proper pipetting, basic cell culture, aseptic technique, wet lab work, and environmental monitoring.
4dc67054-12c7-4500-973e-6dfb6f1f4982.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Biotech Boot Camp

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners are required to complete each module in UMBC’s Biotech Boot Camp online course.

a0d16c84-dbc2-4397-98e2-6f2e6f91ac04.description: This badge is recognition of two years of service as an IRS certified volunteer income tax preparer. The badge earner is dedicated to providing a much needed service to individuals that may not be able to afford it and is equipped to provide tax assistance.
a0d16c84-dbc2-4397-98e2-6f2e6f91ac04.name: UMBC VITA Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: UMBC VITA Badge
Perform tax preparation services for at least 25 hours per tax season for two years

548988c4-ec5a-4564-9313-ecaed54241cf.description: This badge signifies learning and skill development in the area of leadership. Participants who hold this badge have enhanced their leadership and administrative skillset, including assessing strengths, organizational skills, interpersonal skills, customer service, and career management.
548988c4-ec5a-4564-9313-ecaed54241cf.name: Building Bridges: Administrative Leadership Development Cohort

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Be nominated by Deans and VPs
Participate in the Building Bridges program

63fb087b-bf0e-4fcd-8dcc-df397c0a232c.description: This two-day training session provided both a discussion on new cognitive technologies and hands-on labs that support these rapidly evolving fields. Participants learned more about designing complex neural networks and experiments at scale. Also discuss techniques used to optimize learning models to run more efficiently. The workshop will provide hands-on labs showing details around Tensorflow, Caffe, IBM Watson Machine Learning Community Edition, H2O Driverless AI, and PowerAI Vision.
63fb087b-bf0e-4fcd-8dcc-df397c0a232c.name: UMBC-IBM Deep Learning

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 2-day Deep Learning workshop (july 11-12, 2019)
Complete all hands-on labs involved in the 2-day training

skills.name: IBM Watson Machine Learning Community Edition

4d8b6065-70ff-4797-aa7c-f7dd231e9ca9.description: Earners of UMBC's Summer Enrichment Academy Cyber I badge have completed hands-on activities in ethical hacking, digital forensics, and open-source investigation. Students learn about industry requirements and exploring the many possibilities for choosing a career in cybersecurity.
4d8b6065-70ff-4797-aa7c-f7dd231e9ca9.name: Summer Enrichment Academy: Cyber I

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete Cyber I or 15 hours of the course equivalent.

2859fb1c-051d-4e70-b4f2-3ab1f01b0d32.description: Earners of the Hybrid Workplace Foundations badge have completed 5 Hybrid Workplace Foundations modules. With the gradual return to campus, the Hybrid Workplace series offers staff training in the available productivity and collaboration tools that will help contribute to individual and shared success in a hybrid workplace.
2859fb1c-051d-4e70-b4f2-3ab1f01b0d32.name: Hybrid Workplace Foundations

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The participant must complete 5 of the 6 Hybrid Workplace modules.

abc1081a-6a98-48ac-8f34-5675df5ac0ff.description: The badge earner is a faculty member who is offering hybrid or online courses and can carefully evaluate the components of a hybrid or online course to ensure that it meets nationally identified quality standards.
abc1081a-6a98-48ac-8f34-5675df5ac0ff.name: Alternate Delivery Program (ADP) Quality Booster

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The Quality Booster track is designed for faculty who are already offering hybrid or online courses, but who have either not previously participated in formal course redesign training through the ADP or participated in ADP prior to the Quality Matters (QM) process integration.
Provide Department Chair’s letter of support and attend the Kick-Off/Information Session.
Complete the Quality Matters Instructor Worksheet and a Self Review of the designated course.
Redesign course based on the results of the Self Review, and complete Instructional Technology Specialist review of redesigned courses against the Quality Matters (QM) rubric.
Offer the redesigned course and complete an evaluation of the ADP process.

77460b3c-7ed3-47a9-b35d-cfa886a80253.description: This badge signifies learning and skill development in a UMBC-created Supervision SkillSoft certificate track. Participants who hold this badge understand delegation, development, confronting difficult employees, and managing diverse teams.
77460b3c-7ed3-47a9-b35d-cfa886a80253.name: Supervision

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 8 e-learning modules, 3 lessons, and 2 skillbriefs in supervision coursework
Pass with a grade of 70% or higher for each module

d513e6a6-ba51-4dac-815f-06d0b3a4b21f.description: This badge signifies learning and skill development in a UMBC-created Administrative Professional SkillSoft certificate track. Participants have an understanding of interpersonal skills, managing tasks and priorities, communication, compliance and customer service.
d513e6a6-ba51-4dac-815f-06d0b3a4b21f.name: Administrative Professional

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 5 e-learning modules and 3 lessons in administrative coursework
Pass with a grade of 70% or higher for each module

d4df474c-196d-4980-bf3f-3b52302e0ec6.description: The badge earner is a faculty member who can develop a hybrid or online course using Blackboard's Ultra Experience and supporting technologies, including course management tools, building accessible course content, screencasting and Panopto, communication and messaging tools, Blackboard Collaborate, tests and assignments, grading and rubrics, and learning analytics.
d4df474c-196d-4980-bf3f-3b52302e0ec6.name: Alternate Delivery Program (ADP) Course Designer

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate Skill Builder competencies and submit your Department Chair's letter of support. Faculty who participate in the Course Designer track should have prior experience teaching in summer or winter sessions and convert courses that have a proven enrollment “track record” in Summer or Winter Sessions.
Attend the 3-day Course Design Workshop and 2 milestone brown bag sessions coordinated by the Instructional Technology team.

Develop the hybrid or online course in Blackboard's Ultra Experience. Engage/interact with ADP Cohort and specialists within the ADP Blackboard organization and complete the Course Development Milestone Worksheet with your specialist to map out the timeline for completing your course redesign.

Complete Instructional Technology Specialist review of redesigned courses against the Quality Matters (QM) rubric, meeting a minimum benchmark of 85% and all 3-point essential standards. Complete peer faculty content review to ensure content is in alignment with the course description and departmental expectations. Present a design concept you adopted during the ADP process at the closing milestone meeting.
Offer the designated hybrid or online course and complete an evaluation of the ADP process.

e82f8d85-1142-45e1-8ba8-ff015c629bc6.description: This badge signifies learning and skill development in a UMBC-created Diversity SkillSoft certificate track. Participants who hold this badge understand the importance of a diversity in the workplace and ways one can promote a culture of inclusivity.
e82f8d85-1142-45e1-8ba8-ff015c629bc6.name: Diversity

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 3 e-learning modules and 4 business exploration series in diversity coursework
Pass with a grade of 70% or higher for each module

9cb4d76b-9d30-4bce-ae9d-899bd1c453d2.description: The badge earner is a faculty member who can discuss the key course tools and course building features of Blackboard Ultra Course View, evaluate a course's readiness to upgrade to the Ultra Experience, and build a basic course using the Ultra Course View.
9cb4d76b-9d30-4bce-ae9d-899bd1c453d2.name: Blackboard (Bb) Ultra Experience Early Adopter

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Adopt Blackboard's Ultra Experience during UMBC's year-long migration

6a193686-0405-419d-8c62-bc9dd8548435.description: The First-Gen Advocate Badge is designed to acknowledge successful completion of the First-Gen Advocacy training by UMBC community members. Earners have completed a series of training modules designed to inform them of the characteristics of first-gen college students and how they can better support these students in their success.
6a193686-0405-419d-8c62-bc9dd8548435.name: First-Gen Advocate

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of modules in Blackboard course where participants earned a score of 80% or higher

e244d079-8029-4d91-a8ea-c8a2ded4e57a.description: This badge signifies learning and skill development in a UMBC-created Leadership SkillSoft certificate track. Participants who hold this badge understand inspirational leadership, leading change, emotional intelligence, influence, and employee motivation.
e244d079-8029-4d91-a8ea-c8a2ded4e57a.name: Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 8 e-learning modules in leadership coursework
Pass with a grade of 70% or higher for each module

4e572629-8424-4f57-b4ea-95a4c164f362.description: Earners of this badge have addressed the fundamentals of Asset Based Community Development (ABCD), and learned how to practically implement ABCD in students' daily professional practice while developing a community of practice using ABCD, as well as, becoming ABCD practitioners in the field. Working through an ABCD process, participants can move towards whole-community mobilization through mapping the capacities assets of individuals, associations, and institutions while building relationships.
4e572629-8424-4f57-b4ea-95a4c164f362.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Asset Based Community Development

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the Asset Based Community Development course or 12.5 hours of the course equivalent.

858745b3-0125-4437-88d5-a4e1bf509e36.description: This badge addresses the application of restorative justice/restorative practices to community leadership frameworks. Restorative practices is a relational framework grounded in interdisciplinary theories and collective processes. When creating spaces for engaged learning, inclusive decision-making, and social capital building, restorative practices has potential to transform communities and systems by allowing community members to maintain and sustain relationships even when harm has occurred.
858745b3-0125-4437-88d5-a4e1bf509e36.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Restorative Practices

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the Restorative Practices course or 12.5 hours of the course equivalent.

e7af9ab4-5a0f-4d1a-9108-d49e9083536a.description: This badge signifies learning and skill development in a UMBC-created Microsoft Office SkillSoft certificate track. Participants who hold this badge can use Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint either at a beginner or an advanced level.
e7af9ab4-5a0f-4d1a-9108-d49e9083536a.name: Microsoft Office

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 6-7 e-learning modules in Microsoft Office coursework
Pass with a grade of 70% or higher for each module

e65268af-8a6d-4e0c-b3fc-9f25aff3e1f7.description: This badge signifies learning and skill development in a UMBC-created Professional Foundations SkillSoft certificate track. Participants who hold this badge understand business writing, critical thinking and personal productivity.
e65268af-8a6d-4e0c-b3fc-9f25aff3e1f7.name: Professional Foundations

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 13 e-learning modules in professional foundations coursework
Pass with a grade of 70% or higher for each module

62a6f3cf-f6de-4fb9-ad0c-993ae9800f79.description: This badge signifies learning and skill development in the area of supervision. Earners can look within and cultivate awareness about how they engage conversationally with employees.
62a6f3cf-f6de-4fb9-ad0c-993ae9800f79.name: Essential Supervisor Conversations

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 5 session supervisor cohort program
Submit a reflective statement to provide evidence of learning

dbe89a2f-86cd-43a0-8586-25ca2ba72579.description: Earners of UMBC's Institute of Extended Learning's Devices and Combination Products badge have examined the ins and outs of the rapidly growing combination products market. Earners have learned about combination product lifecycle management and the regulatory environment for these products.
dbe89a2f-86cd-43a0-8586-25ca2ba72579.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Devices and Combination Products

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the Devices and Combination Products course or 44 hours of the course equivalent.

de1dadd3-ced0-402a-b417-fb322f865a67.description: Earners of UMBC's Institute of Extended Learning's Quality Control and Quality Assurance for Biotechnology Products badge have demonstrated a general knowledge of topics such Quality Control Methods, QC Microbiology, Bioassay Design, Experimental Design, QC Package for rDNA Products, QC Package for Monoclonal Antibody, Assay Validation, Qualification and Transfer, Elements of QA in a Multiproduct Facility, Comparability, and Barr Decision, OOS, and QbD.
de1dadd3-ced0-402a-b417-fb322f865a67.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Quality Control and Quality Assurance for Biotechnology Products

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners are required to complete each module in UMBC’s Quality Control and Quality Assurance for Biotechnology Products online course.

e9a40406-6e67-45d7-a3b1-664e1958c58f.description: The badge earner is familiar with new cognitive technologies and hands-on labs that support these rapidly evolving fields. Earners understand the process of designing complex neural networks and experiments at scale, as well as techniques used to optimize learning models to run more efficiently. The earner has demonstrated an ability to use tools such as Tensorflow, Caffe, IBM Watson Machine Learning Community Edition, H2O Driverless AI, and PowerAI Vision.

262ef958-827b-49ec-8e3b-3c7798e31d9a.description: Earners of UMBC's Data Science Academy's Data Science 1 badge have demonstrated a general understanding of extracting data from various websites and sources, manipulating data in multiple formats, and visualizing data. They learn to use R the premier statistical programming language used in many industries such as finance, healthcare, and social media. They also learn different ways of data management within R using top tier techniques.

24af62b4-0ee4-479a-a2db-8d120531a3bb.description: Earners of the Hybrid Workplace Strategic Planning badge have completed 5 Hybrid Workplace Strategic Planning modules. With the gradual return to campus, the Hybrid Workplace series offers staff training in the available productivity and collaboration tools that will help contribute to individual and shared success in a hybrid workplace.

They have enhanced their career empowerment, interviewing, and negotiation skills.

Submit a short reflection paper at the end of the series detailing career insights gleaned from the sessions and how you plan to take action in more effectively managing your career.

5f4c5ade-9b4f-4d94-93f5-2f72f6cf1a99.description: Earners of UMBC's Data Science Academy's Data Science III badge have demonstrated being able to access Data-Deepening Knowledgebase of SQL within R and Cloud Computing via Amazon Web Services Complex Visualizations.

0b29ef98-466f-436f-a692-a38b53682bb6.description: Earners of UMBC's Institute of Extended Learning's Biotechnology GMP Facility Design, Construction and Validation badge have examined the engineering design of a biotech facility under GMP compliance. Topics covered include architectural considerations, bulk plant design, process equipment design, utilities, instrumentation, controls and computerization, facility and software validation.
0b29ef98-466f-436f-a692-a38b53682bb6.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Biotechnology GMP Facility Design, Construction, and Validation

23935a5e-bde3-4275-ba13-913de2ce0841.description: Earners of this badge have examined an in-depth exploration of the chemical and biochemical processes fundamental to the different stages of the brewing process. Topics will include water chemistry, malting and grain processing, the organic chemistry of hops, and the biochemistry of wort production. They will have explored how fundamental chemical and biochemical processes affect different aspects of the brewing process as well as specific qualities of the beer produced.
23935a5e-bde3-4275-ba13-913de2ce0841.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Brewing I: From Raw Materials to Fermentable Wort

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the Brewing I: From Raw Materials to Fermentable Wort course or 15 hours of the course equivalent.

0160e30f-706b-4c7c-896a-a1ce2eb8c3c9.description: Earners of UMBC's Institute of Extended Learning's Development and Regulation of Biopharmaceuticals badge have examined topics such as Quality by Design, Good Lab Practice, Molecule Design by QbD, Vaccine Potency Testing, Design of Clinical Trials, Vaccine Regulation and Preclinical Studies, cGMP Manufacturing and Compliance, and COVID-19 Disease and Biopharmaceutical Approaches.
0160e30f-706b-4c7c-896a-a1ce2eb8c3c9.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Development and Regulation of Biopharmaceuticals

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the Development and Regulation of Biopharmaceuticals course or 44 hours of the course equivalent.

ab1fc1f6-763d-4291-a219-fd28759f73dd.description: Earners of UMBC's Institute of Extended Learning's Development & Regulation of Biopharmaceuticals badge have demonstrated a general understanding of medical devices & combination products, a basic knowledge of quality control & quality assurance for biotechnology products, and are able to identify key concepts about the development & regulation of biopharmaceuticals.
ab1fc1f6-763d-4291-a219-fd28759f73dd.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Development & Regulation of Biopharmaceuticals

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners are required to complete each module in UMBC’s Development & Regulation of Biopharmaceuticals online course.

69740515-9c25-42cb-8737-a91e76e52faa.description: Earners of UMBC's Institute of Extended Learning's Medical Devices and Combination Products badge have demonstrated a general understanding of the current setup of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for the evaluation of devices and combination products, an understanding of the process of Medical Devices and Combination Products development, and an understanding of the various regulatory agencies and the diverse product approval requirements in both domestic and international markets.
69740515-9c25-42cb-8737-a91e76e52faa.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Medical Devices and Combination Products

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners are required to complete each module in UMBC’s Medical Devices and Combination Products online course.

Topics include building and facilities, equipment design, utilities, in-process controls, records and adequate process validation.

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

898c5837-d029-40a9-8c5d-64ac0708b17f.description: The course objective is to describe the major networking technologies and systems of modern networks, and be able to configure, manage, and troubleshoot modern networks. Prerequisites: CompTIA A+ or equivalent experience.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

1abbf492-2296-4aa5-86b8-8b5d15de7508.description: The course provides the knowledge and skills to identify risk, participate in risk mitigation, and provide infrastructure, application, information, and operational security. Students apply security controls to maintain confidentiality, integrity, and availability, identify appropriate technologies and products, troubleshoot security events and incidents, and operate with an awareness of applicable policies, laws, and regulations. Prerequisites: CompTIA A+ and Network+ or equivalent experience.

Classroom lectures stress the importance of writing efficient, maintainable, and portable code. The lectures are supplemented with real-world lab exercises.

aa522dc1-053c-4929-86c5-e835826db879.description: Earners of the Critical Thinker badge have the ability to analyze and evaluate thinking and commit to constant improvement.
aa522dc1-053c-4929-86c5-e835826db879.name: Critical Thinker

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Raising vital questions and problems, formulating them clearly and precisely.
Gathering and assessing relevant information, using abstract ideas to interpret it effectively.
Coming to well-reasoned conclusions and solutions, testing them against relevant criteria and standards.
Thinking open-mindedly within alternative systems of thought.
Recognizing and assessing, as need be, one’s own assumptions, implications, and practical consequences.
Communicating effectively with others in figuring out solutions to complex problems.

2f92188c-5f2b-4ede-a86f-62b333513c6c.description: The course objective is to enable students to understand, recognize, and manipulate basic data structures such as linked lists and trees. The general course topics include algebra, complexity analysis, abstract data types, arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, heaps, binary search trees, sorting, and searching.
2f92188c-5f2b-4ede-a86f-62b333513c6c.name: Data Structures & Algorithms I

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include skill demonstration with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include practical exercises, classroom exercises, and lecture.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

3f70e80c-4033-4800-a993-ec429f11e1f2.description: The course objective is to enable students to understand, recognize, and write simple algorithms on known data structures. The general course topics include priority queues, hashing, cryptography, graphs, path algorithms, compression algorithms, and encryption algorithms.
3f70e80c-4033-4800-a993-ec429f11e1f2.name: Data Structures & Algorithms II

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

88d8376e-a6af-4c01-944a-65f8f6413892.description: The First-Gen Grad Badge is designed to acknowledge first-generation college students who are UMBC alumni.
88d8376e-a6af-4c01-944a-65f8f6413892.name: First-Gen Graduate

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Earned a degree at UMBC.
Are first generation college graduate.

e05e51b7-65ab-4b73-aa2a-8ab49696ccbc.description: Earners of the Globalist badge understand international issues, learn from and work with people from diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds, and possess skills to function productively in an interdependent world community. The earner demonstrates critical analysis of and engagement with global systems, including natural, physical, social, cultural, economic, and political systems.
e05e51b7-65ab-4b73-aa2a-8ab49696ccbc.name: Globalist

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Recognizing differences across and within world cultures and the diverse viewpoints that emerge from these differences.
Identifying developments and trends associated with historical or contemporary global issues.
Developing a sense of personal and civic responsibility with respect to global issues.
Applying communication skills and strategies, including the ability to use another language, to interact effectively with people from other cultures.
Analyzing the power structures, complexities and interdependencies of global systems.
Evaluating solutions to global challenges using interdisciplinary perspectives.

1e6d0e4e-323f-404d-8d57-64357c38d235.description: Earners of UMBC's Institute of Extended Learning's Biotech in the Age of Covid-19 badge have examined the biological basis of a pandemic, and how COVID-19 has informed our current approaches to relevant topics in biotechnology, such as technical development and regulatory and compliance, epidemiology, biosafety and biosecurity, data science, public health and policy considerations. They have also examined the historical, ethical and public health perspectives that accompany pandemics.
1e6d0e4e-323f-404d-8d57-64357c38d235.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Biotech in the Age of COVID-19

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the Biotech in the Age of COVID-19 course or 36 hours of the course equivalent.

4d58fb97-15f6-44f4-af3e-bf1b779f1abc.description: Earners of UMBC's Institute of Extended Learning's Substance Exposed Newborns (SEN) Online Training Course have coved the following topics: covered in this training include: - Developmental effects of substance use on infants and children - The experiences of substance-using pregnant women - Strategies for working with families - Addiction and recovery - Treatment goals and challenges - Motivational communication - Trauma, mental health, and compassion fatigue.
4d58fb97-15f6-44f4-af3e-bf1b779f1abc.name: Institute of Extended Learning: Substance Exposed Newborns (SEN) Online Training

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Students have 45 days to complete the 9 modules.

e44333f1-d2a6-43d8-9480-2f43d48a18aa.description: Earners of the Intercultural badge values, respects, and learns from diverse cultures, races, ages, genders, sexual orientations, and religions. The earner demonstrates openness, inclusiveness, sensitivity, and the ability to interact respectfully with all people and understand individuals’ differences.
e44333f1-d2a6-43d8-9480-2f43d48a18aa.name: Interculturalist

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Identifying one’s cultural norms and values.
Articulating how one’s experience shapes cultural norms and values and how culture shapes personal experience.
Analyzing how cultural norms and values affect one’s interactions with others.
Recognizing the commonalities and differences that exist among people and cultures and how these factors influence one’s relationships with others.
Understanding the influence of history, geography, religion, gender, race, ethnicity, and other factors on one’s identity and the identities of others.
Questioning explicit and implicit forms of power, privilege, inequality, and inequity
Engaging with people and ideas from other cultures with courage, sensitivity, openness, and curiosity.

9f9f08e7-6194-4282-ad47-f65ee35c8393.description: The course objective is to broaden the skills of a C language programmer by introducing sophisticated problem solving techniques including the advanced use of pointers, abstract data types, data structures, portability, and optimization techniques. Skills are reinforced by hands-on laboratory exercises.
9f9f08e7-6194-4282-ad47-f65ee35c8393.name: Intermediate C Programming

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, practical exercises, discussion, classroom exercises, and lecture.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

39eb7fb5-8860-4733-91e3-5d685fa4acd0.description: The course objective is to teach the student information systems and technology fundamentals as the starting point for a cyber-related career. It is the foundation onto which more advanced topics in systems administration and cybersecurity are built. This course will give students the knowledge and skills to set up and use a computer securely and to safely maintain it. Students will be able to provide informal support for personal computers and simple local area networks.
39eb7fb5-8860-4733-91e3-5d685fa4acd0.name: IT Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visuals, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lecture, and classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

22310702-45d9-4f77-960b-0936ce1b877f.description: Earners of the Leader badge have the ability to leverage the strengths of others to achieve common goals, and use interpersonal skills to coach and develop others. They are able to assess and manage self and others; use empathetic skills to guide and motivate; and organize, prioritize, and delegate work.
22310702-45d9-4f77-960b-0936ce1b877f.name: Leader

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Assessing individual and collective strengths, weaknesses, and capacities to achieve the desired goal.
Engaging diverse or competing perspectives.
Motivating others.
Articulating a vision and strategy.
Organizing, prioritizing, and delegating work, roles, and responsibilities.
Reflecting on how one’s leadership affects process and outcomes and adjusting as appropriate.
Reviewing outcomes and assessing implications for future plans.

0201db28-2cdf-484e-bad4-35da06c90d80.description: The course teaches students to perform basic Linux tasks from the command-line then quickly move into system-wide administration tasks. Students will learn to manage local users and groups; manage files and directories; allocate and create storage and file systems; manage system components; use TCP/IP networking to manage local networking components; manage software bundles and packages; understand software dependencies; write simple Bash shell scripts; and install a Linux distribution.
0201db28-2cdf-484e-bad4-35da06c90d80.name: Linux Operating System Essentials and Administration

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

997ecb56-b4c4-41f8-8fb6-c60b2044f7c5.description: The course objective is to teach the student the fundamental concepts, methodologies, and tools necessary to analyze common network traffic.
997ecb56-b4c4-41f8-8fb6-c60b2044f7c5.name: Network and Packet Analysis

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

579a7fa1-325d-49ee-810c-3bf8b70c0cf4.description: The course objective is to enable students to write complex networking programs in C. The general course topics include ethernet, Internet, Internet Version 6, UDP, TCP, client/server architecture, producer/consumer architecture, multiplexing, and worker pools. Prerequisites: Basic C Programming skills and Python knowledge
579a7fa1-325d-49ee-810c-3bf8b70c0cf4.name: Network Programming in C

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

7f81579c-54bb-4961-be8d-c65ebb30bd57.description: The course objective is to enable students to design, create, and use high -level objects to abstract away low-level details in programs. Prerequisites: Competency with the Python programming language and knowledge of data structures.
7f81579c-54bb-4961-be8d-c65ebb30bd57.name: Object Oriented Programming Using Python

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

65d69c31-e35c-4877-a98f-629cff9b9e97.description: The course objective is to enable students to manipulate OS resources when writing programs. The general course topics include process memory, OS memory virtualization, file structure, filesystem features, OS resource management, file and memory locks, semaphores, pipes, threads, concurrency, parallelism, and user permissions.
65d69c31-e35c-4877-a98f-629cff9b9e97.name: Operating Systems

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include skills demonstration with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include practical exercises, classroom exercises, and lecture.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

6b41dc5c-250f-4c5d-827d-e83694fac4b5.description: The course objective is to perform a basic penetration test, including preparatory research, conducting active network scanning, and conducting exploitation to prepare for advanced training or work as a member in a penetration testing team. Students will also be able to work as a defensive information security analyst.
6b41dc5c-250f-4c5d-827d-e83694fac4b5.name: Penetration Testing Methodology

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, practical exercises, discussion, classroom exercises, lecture, and computer-based training.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 4 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

d18e768a-3624-4861-9d41-424be5e1249d.description: Earners of the Problem-Solver badge have the skills necessary to resolve complex problems/challenges through exercising sound reasoning to analyze issues, make decisions, and overcome challenges. The earner is able to obtain, interpret, and use knowledge, facts, and data in this process, and may demonstrate originality and inventiveness.
d18e768a-3624-4861-9d41-424be5e1249d.name: Problem-Solver

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Articulating the problem.
Identifying the desired end result.
Brainstorming creative options for achieving the desired end result.
Analyzing and selecting the option that best achieves the desired end result.
Developing a plan of action that will achieve the desired end result.
Enacting the plan of action and adapting as needed.
Evaluating the outcomes in relationship to the desired goals.

94b014c6-0df6-4f66-af4d-4e28dcb55615.description: Earners of the Professional badge demonstrate accountability, effective work habits, personal accountability, and commitment.
94b014c6-0df6-4f66-af4d-4e28dcb55615.name: Professional

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: Taking responsibility for one’s actions and outcomes.
Examining the implications of one’s own behavior and decisions.
Acknowledging mistakes and learning from them.
Following through on commitments.
Persevering in the face of challenges and changes.
Acting with the interest of the larger community in mind.
Evaluating one’s own performance over time and making adjustments.

66e758d8-78af-4b1f-9c00-ac4ce13a033c.description: The course objective is to introduce the student to the Python programming language and provide the skills necessary to write Python programs to accomplish a variety of programming tasks. The general course topics include fundamental data types such as numbers and strings; conditional statements and program control flow; basic built-in data structures; GUI and web based programing; input and output to files and databases.
66e758d8-78af-4b1f-9c00-ac4ce13a033c.name: Python Programming

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes and skills demonstration with a minimum passing score 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, practical exercises, discussion, classroom exercises, and lecture.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

4c389ba3-d755-4492-bd2d-185922dbcc99.description: The course objective is to write Python programs that use an SQL database on the server side and provide an interface to the user using web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Prerequisites: Competency with Python programming language and some knowledge of data structures.
4c389ba3-d755-4492-bd2d-185922dbcc99.name: SQL Development in Python

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include performance rubrics with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, practical exercises, discussion, classroom exercises, and lecture.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

50bbd508-a173-4f65-8311-45b553549b5a.description: Earners of UMBC's Summer Enrichment Academy Machine Learning and Statistics I badge will have developed the ability to mine, manipulate and visualize data and have learned how to extract data from websites such as Wikipedia, GitHub and other data science websites.
50bbd508-a173-4f65-8311-45b553549b5a.name: Summer Enrichment Academy: Machine Learning and Statistics I

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete Machine Learning and Statistics I or 15 hours of the course equivalent.

1cf05cb4-e610-48ea-81e9-05c25391ce0e.description: Earners of UMBC's Summer Enrichment Academy Machine Learning and Statistics II badge will have covered statistical inferences by learning various methods such as two sample means and proportion comparisons, analysis of variance, and Chi-Square Tests using R and real data. Students learn the process of straight-forward machine learning algorithms such regression, K-Nearest Neighbors and Decision Trees using data sets within R.
1cf05cb4-e610-48ea-81e9-05c25391ce0e.name: Summer Enrichment Academy: Machine Learning and Statistics II

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete Machine Learning and Statistics II or 15 hours of the course equivalent.

cb7c494d-6c30-449f-ad34-1a804843a3b6.description: The course objective is to enable students to write and read assembly code. The general course topics include executable programs, disassembly tools, CPU organization, register layout, memory and latency, assignment, arithmetic, floating-point numbers, conditionals, loops, jump tables, functions, string functions, signals and interrupts, and inline assembly.
cb7c494d-6c30-449f-ad34-1a804843a3b6.name: x86 Assembly Programming

issuer.summary: issued by University of Maryland, Baltimore County

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include skills demonstration with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include practical exercises, discussion, classroom exercises, and lecture.
